website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys EA6900 AC1900 Smart Wi-Fi Router is a high-performance?and high-priced?router that's easy to manage. It's a good fit for multi-device home networks with lots of movie and TV streaming, Skype use, and online gaming.
pros: Speedy NAS functionality with connected USB drives
cons: Problems with disconnects at 2.4GHz band using Linksys WUSB6300 wireless USB adapter

customer_reviews.title: Very poor wi-fi range
customer_reviews.text: I use this product quite a lot with my job because it is good for 'routing' especially when you have Airplay products in the setup which require the Bonjour service.Set it up properly and it will work a dream BUT the wi-fi range is appalling! You get much better signal strength from most of the devices you get for free from your internet providers. I don't know why they bother putting 3 wireless antennas on it. To get a good network setup you can have your main modem/router that comes from BT/VIRGIN/Talktalk etc. in modem mode, use the Linksys as a subnet, turn the wi-fi off on the Linksys and get some decent wireless access points trough out the house.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance at a Price to Match.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade from my Service Providers initial free Router, to a faster one with a better range. After extensive research, and reading of reviews I decided on the Linksys EA6900. I have definitely not been disappointed. It ticks the boxes for range and speed. Setting - up was simple and I had it fully operational in about 10 minutes. For a first upgrade it was spot-on, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the same position.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Do you have the patience of a saint and a p.Hd in router set up???
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy an extender as this wasn't enough. I live in a two bed flat.... not exactly brilliant. Also the stupid antennae never stay up and the wifi connection gets lost instantly. the features are quite difficult to navigate and setting it up required a p.Hd and far more patience than I posses. Why did I give it a three? It was better than what I had before!! The amount of ports on the back has been very useful in a busy tech heavy household though (there are only two adults I wonder if it would be enough if you had kids as well....)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The lights come on but no one's home. No wifi nor wired signal coming out of it. Dead as a doorknob. Kaput. C'est mort. Admittedly it worked fine for those 2 years, but at this price I'd expect a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this one
customer_reviews.text: Great router - on paper... after six month started to cut connections and the situation progressively got worth. By month 11 it was not able to keep connections (both LAN and WiFi) for more that 5 - 10 minutes after reset/restart. Search on internet reveals a myriad of common problems with it, its firmware and overheating problem. When it worked- it was fine. However, printer server software is not the best around - Asus has much better solution. Bottom line - stay away from it - there better and more reliable ones at this price level.
customer_reviews.author: W. Skorko

customer_reviews.title: buy something else if concerned about security
customer_reviews.text: Great product, nice and fast but no longer using due to security concerns, it is not possible to disable the ability to logon as admin from the internet, so the router could get hacked without you knowing about it.. buy something else from another Vendor, I have had to due to these security issues
customer_reviews.author: Ken S.

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy to set up and has a good range. But one of the reasons I bought this was to change my DNS to Open DNS (my older router made this very difficult). However, a bug in the firmware of this route means I can't do this - I wouldn't have bought it if I had known this before hand, I just assumed a modern router would be able to cope with this. The product support chat (in broken chinglish) didn't help at all.
customer_reviews.author: David Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great first router, bad for an upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: As a router its good if your buying one to start with, however expected to be a marked increase in range as an alternative to the BT home hub 4. But only slightly better. Not enough to justify the price. If you looking to better a "bog standard" router you will probably be a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Owen

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my last decent router
customer_reviews.text: I bought an expensive router a year back but wifi would not extend into next room never mind upstairs. Bought this as a replacement and it's brilliant. No need for home plug extended network access point complexity and different SSID all over the house. Now have just one network - bliss. So so so pleased with this and SmartWifi on my iPhone is brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Simon M Ordish

customer_reviews.title: excellent wifi speeds if you can manage to  get a good signal
customer_reviews.text: Pros: lots of features parental controls, ftp, remote access etc Cons: unreliable signal in two bedroom house (UK). Router is downstairs and the signal is unreliable in both upstairs bedrooms. Tried different bands and frequencies. If you can manage to get a good signal the router can provide up to 100mb speed on wifi (VM).
customer_reviews.author: Usman Mahmud

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with Virgin Media
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work with Virgin Media Superhub in Mode Mode. Spent hours on the phone with Virgin tech support trying to get it to work. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Works but gets warm
customer_reviews.text: Does the job you would expect it to be. Only downsides are that I had a question for their support team that was obviously more technical than their usual question, and as a result they couldn't help me. Also as mentioned by other reviews it does get rather warm. So just 4 stars as a result.
customer_reviews.author: BSS

customer_reviews.title: Great solid router.
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement wifi router for my Apple router. IT has great features and solid set of security features for most none tech users and well as the person that wants to get a little more under the hood.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Those 3 antennas are a big sham - it ain't a router with a good range.
customer_reviews.text: Total rubbish, has less range and power than my Virgin Media as well as Sky routers. Those 3 antennas are a big sham - it ain't a router with a good range.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Useless with ADSL
customer_reviews.text: I've given it only two stars on the basis that it has no ADSL connection and therefore unless you have a modem in line it's useless.. Why have an apparent all singing, dancing 'best reviewed' router is clearly designed to work behind a modem. This should be made clear in the product description OR supply a £3.00 RJ11/RJ45 converter cable.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good router, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: As a router it was very good and the config software easy to use. Couldn't get the USB printer driver to work with my Canon printer without crashing the computer. Hence ended up returning it
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Levine

customer_reviews.title: My fault, but I hadn't realised that it did ...
customer_reviews.text: My fault, but I hadn't realised that it did not come with an inbuilt modem so had to use my old router in series to utilise it as a modem. it did increase the range and power of the signal around the house though.
customer_reviews.author: David Farnfield

customer_reviews.title: the unit itself seems great, but the AC signal is very weak and ...
customer_reviews.text: the unit itself seems great, but the AC signal is very weak and is easily stopped by any internal walls
customer_reviews.author: magpies11

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Replacement for a Technicolor TG582n .Using fast-fibre, the download speed is similar for both models but the upload speed is certainly better for the Linksys unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner G

customer_reviews.title: Range is worse than 8 year old N router
customer_reviews.text: This performed significantly worse in terms of range, than the Linksys WRT610N that I had before. The apps and attached storage etc seemed to all work well, but with the range being so poor I sent it back and went back to the old router.
customer_reviews.author: Earton

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: not much difference in terms of speed and wireless signal to my linskys e4200
customer_reviews.author: R. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Range not quite as good as I expected form the description but easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: P J Tinsley

customer_reviews.title: As useful as a chocolate fireguard
customer_reviews.text: As useful as a chocolate fireguard. Very week signal through brick walls and cannot cope with wooden floors. Great if you are in the same room
customer_reviews.author: Michael May

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great coverage. Infinitely superior to the Talktalkrouter which was pants!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Learmont-Hughes

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this router for wi fi and it is excellent compared with BT Hub4
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router for wi fi and it is excellent compared with BT Hub4.
customer_reviews.author: Bhupa

customer_reviews.title: Great product with very easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Great product with very easy setup. Massively improved my wifi signal across the whole house and I now get full signal in my office which is at the bottom of my garden about 12m from the main house and around 20m from router. Also improved my overall speeds on each device utilising the 5Ghz speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for semi pro use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router for semi pro use, but not the best wifi coverage, but for the price and the product features and design takes the stars.
customer_reviews.author: alvis

customer_reviews.title: Average router
customer_reviews.text: It performance as expected yet the user interface lacks features which are present on £30 routers. It targets non technical people who need a standard AP with good reliability
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of kit ,everything as described in the resume
customer_reviews.author: Mr G K MANN

customer_reviews.title: Linksys EA6900
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, very easy. Performance does not match the price. I wouldn't buy one next time round. My old E200o had better performance
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good signal strength, easy setup, my best ever router so far
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A great router
customer_reviews.text: This router is very easy to set up and works ad it should. The wireless reception and speed is very inpressive. I would recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: easy to install. much larger coverage and 3xtimes the speed of my previous linksys n . 90 Mbit/s versus 30 .
customer_reviews.author: Herve R.Gehin

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very good product but not easy to setup. I'm still trying to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Bizi

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: good device, advanced technology, can control by smartphones. The disadvantage of long-distance, overall a very good for internet speed .
customer_reviews.author: ali al tani

customer_reviews.title: A bit dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: It works but not as good as I thought it would be. It's not worth the price in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Pemu Mungai

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not help my wireless connection, but that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Not quite!
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to reach a bit further than the old one I had!
customer_reviews.author: w. tabacznik

customer_reviews.title: disappointing performance - BT Homehub in hindsight is better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping that an expensive linksys product would have much better performance than a the BT home hub. Having set it up my work laptop kept dropping its VPN and the mobile phone looses it all the time. I only managed to improve the VPN by making it a high priority device but even so the other devices like internet radios are performing worse than with the home hub. Sorry to say it is going back and was a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: James Pigott

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery and many thanks firstly! Bought as a SOHO upgrade as have the full SKY Fibre package so thought might be a good idea to upgrade this side especially as my previous hub was beginning to die and struggle. Easy to setup, does everything on the box, like the guest access available on both bandwidths but firewalled from the main network. It's fairy large but it's wall mountable which I intend to. GUI very straightforward to setup, less than 10mins to do it all inc changing SSID and passwords etc. Would recommend without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Parental contols unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I purchased this item specifically for the parental controls, which have the wonderful habit of turning themselves off randomly. To get support from Linksys on this issue you have to pay for it. Apart from that features like the guess network are very handy and from a connectivity point of view there have never been issues. However; if you want a device that allows you to control devices access to the Internet this probably isn't the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very good home wireless network product
customer_reviews.text: I like its intelligent when switching between different ISPs. The recorded settings just work without any changing. Very good product and very efficient dispatch speed.
customer_reviews.author: Landerchan

customer_reviews.title: Serious Router!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about two weeks ago and this is a brilliant bit of kit. I upgraded from a ADSL broadband to a fibre optic and replaced the ISP router with this. This router is a beast, and the speed is brilliant bearing in mind that none of my devices are yet wireless ac. There is a marked increase in network speed. Watching a movie clip from dropbox for example has very little lag compared to my previous router. The downloadable app is also very good and the guest network is also a very handy feature. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mr SIMON Masih

customer_reviews.title: No better than the latest FREE routers!
customer_reviews.text: Despite all the hype this unit is no better than the standard Virgin Media router that was provided free with our cable subscription. No greater range, no better speed and takes up more space! It was also inconsistent in how it worked. Very frustrating. The only reason I gave it 2 stars was because the management features were good. Unfortunately, due to me not using it until after the latest return date, it is now an expensive waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Thought that the QOS part of this system would help prioritise my net over others on my home network. It didn't, wasted my money...
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: This router is the worst
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the worst router I have ever encountered - and I have had a few including other Linksys/CISCO ones; even even still have other CISCO ones. This router was difficult to set-up and to say that it did not play well with other routers is an understatement. I eventually bought the Linksys WRT 1900AC (see I have no issues with Linksys); this set-up like a dream, first time. So if you can afford it get the WRT, if not simply avoid this dog.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and great connectivity. This Router is the best that I have ever used and I have no problem with accessing my Wi-Fi in the garden. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, of no use to me, so sent it back as unfit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a very good router, but unfortunately it was for cable and fibre optic only, so no use to me. I am sure I was not informed at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: This unit needs a separate modem to work - its NOT AN ADSL MODEM & ROUTER - works great and improves the system performance
customer_reviews.author: Xanthy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Range/customer support
customer_reviews.text: Poor WiFi range speeds are excellent though achieved 129 mps down 11.39 up on iphone 6 limited to the speeds of virgin package Poor customer support work from a script ,a non premium UK number is listed on contacts although this is the right department want you to ring the premium number we are on treasure island in the UK ! the rest of Europe can ring on a normal rate number. I would recommend you buy a different brand as if you need support this could be costly , The router appears to be of a cheap build not quality build of my net-gear router it replaced should have stuck with them
customer_reviews.author: Bluman

customer_reviews.title: Poor range on WiFi.
customer_reviews.text: • Poor range on WiFi. Router was placed upstairs in study. directly below was the living room where the reception would frequently drop. My 8 year old Belkin router has better range. •Nas storage with USB HDD refused to work. I tried all my external hard drives- Seagate, Toshiba & WD- none of them would were recognized by the router.
customer_reviews.author: David Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Amazon description wasn't clear enough as this is not a modem too
customer_reviews.text: Amazon description wasn't clear enough as this is not a modem too, it's just a router. Looks very nicely made but when I then bought a router they wouldn't work together, so this has gone back.
customer_reviews.author: AlanJ

product_meta.title: BELKIN EA6900-UK Linksys EA6900 - Smart Wi-Fi Router AC1900 UK Plug
product_meta.description: BELKIN EA6900-UK Linksys EA6900 - Smart Wi-Fi Router AC1900 UK Plug
feature_bullets: NOT an ADSL Router Will not work on Phone line dir
OK for BT Infinity and Virgin
